author: Michael Larabel
description: Merged during this second week of the Linux 6.19 feature merge window were the many x86 platform driver changes. As usual, much of the x86 platform driver activity surrounds bettering Linux hardware laptop support but also a growing number of handheld computers / gaming devices...
title: Exciting Laptop & Gaming Handheld Device Improvements Merged For Linux 6.19

author: Michael Larabel
description: The past few years Oracle has been working on bpftune as a solution for BPF-based, automatic tuning of Linux systems. Bpftune has been available via Oracle Linux and GitHub while finally their open-source GitHub code has seen the first new tagged release in a while...
title: Oracles Releases Updated "bpftune" For BPF-Based Auto-Tuning Of Linux Systems

author: Michael Larabel
description: The Network File-System (NFS) client changes were merged today for the Linux 6.19 kernel with the most notable feature addition being initial support for basic directory delegations...
title: NFS Lands Initial Support For Directory Delegations In Linux 6.19

author: Michael Larabel
description: The Real Time Clock (RTC) driver changes were merged today for Linux 6.19 ahead of the merge window wrapping up on Sunday...
title: New RTC Drivers For Apple & NVIDIA With Linux 6.19

author: Michael Larabel
description: The GNOME.org Extensions hosting for GNOME Shell extensions will no longer accept new contributions with AI-generated code. A new rule has been added to their review guidelines to forbid AI-generated code...
title: New Rule Forbids GNOME Shell Extensions Made Using AI Generated Code

author: Michael Larabel
description: The LoongArch CPU architecture changes have been merged for the Linux 6.19 merge window. This domestic Chinese CPU architecture inspired by MIPS and RISC-V began with 64-bit LoongArch64 but with Linux 6.19 the foundation is being laid for LoongArch32 as a 32-bit variant...
title: LoongArch32 Support Begins Taking Shape In Linux 6.19, GCC 16
